page.title: 12Transport problems.
page.content: If you have your own car you can travel where and when you like but if you rely on public transport you sometimes have problems. Buses travel approximately 1,144 times through the village of Shipham in a year.But this means only one bus to Cheddar twice a day from Monday to Saturday and one bus to Bristol twice a day from Monday to Friday.So as part of our survey we e done a vehicle census just outside the school for 15 minutes on two different days.The results {C L B T V 20/3/85(10.30) 39 13 1 2 1 4/6/85(2.00) 44 8 1 0 8 {C:Cars,L:Lorries,B:Buses,T:Tractors,V: {Vans. }From this it is possible to see that cars are the most common means of transport whether it is in the morning or afternoon.
